Watch: Rahul interrupts Shah with 'open challenge'; gets 'I will decide' reply
description: Lok Sabha witnessed a heated exchange as Rahul Gandhi challenged Home Minister Amit Shah to a debate on the Special Investigation Report and alleged fake voters. Shah firmly stated he would decide the debate's timing and sequence, asserting parliamentary procedure. He countered 'vote chori' claims, referencing past instances and a Delhi High Court case involving Sonia Gandhi.

Jamie Dimon poaches Buffett's investor: Jeff Bezos, Dell join; $1.5T at stake
description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon has formed a high-profile advisory council, including tech titans and defense leaders, to guide a massive $1.5 trillion national security spending plan. The initiative aims to bolster American self-reliance by investing in critical technologies and reducing dependence on foreign suppliers, particularly China.  A new $10 billion fund will back companies in advanced chips and AI.

Democrats compare Kelce to Trump after Texas loss despite Swift support
description: The Democrats' social media account posted a video comparing NFL player Travis Kelce to Donald Trump. This move drew criticism from fans, especially since Kelce's fiancée, Taylor Swift, is a prominent supporter of the Democrats. The video showed Kelce in a game and Trump golfing. Fans expressed confusion and dismay over the comparison, particularly given the Chiefs' playoff struggles.

description: The National Stock Exchange has introduced a 15-minute pre-open session for equity derivatives, a significant structural change aimed at enhancing stability and transparency. This move follows concerns over retail trader losses and volatility in India's hyperactive derivatives market, with the goal of improving price discovery and preventing erratic trades.

title: Caught in SIR storm: BLOs fight fatigue & fear amid crushing deadlines; a look into their daily grind
description: Booth Level Officers (BLOs) in West Bengal are facing immense pressure and exhaustion during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. Working 12-16 hour days, they are struggling with tight deadlines, demanding tasks, and fear of consequences, blurring the lines between work and personal life. Political parties blame each other for the strain.

title: End of road for Samson? Why Gill's return in T20Is tilts debate in Jitesh' favour
description: Jitesh Sharma's emergence as the preferred wicketkeeper-batter for the T20 World Cup signals a strategic shift, prioritizing finishing ability over top-order roles. This selection, alongside the dilemma of fitting both Arshdeep Singh and Kuldeep Yadav, highlights key tactical decisions as India aims for stability ahead of the tournament.

title: Mandhana seen in public for the first time after calling off wedding; social media erupts - Watch
description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has publicly reappeared following the cancellation of her wedding to Palash Muchhal.  Despite a difficult period, she's been seen resuming training, signaling a return to her focus on cricket.  Mandhana confirmed the wedding's halt, requesting privacy for both families as she dedicates herself to representing India.

This meeting occurred as Gandhi's upcoming Berlin visit for an Indian Overseas Congress event drew criticism from the BJP, accusing him of prioritizing foreign trips over parliamentary duties.

This proactive step aims to mitigate the inconvenience caused by extensive delays and cancellations.

Jayden Daniels injury update: Will Commanders QB return in Week 15?
description: Washington Commanders' quarterback Jayden Daniels suffered a setback in his return from an elbow injury, exiting Week 14's game after re-aggravating the issue. Despite the concern, head coach Dan Quinn indicated Daniels won't be shut down, with his Week 15 status against the Giants pending medical clearance. The team prioritizes his development over immediate playoff hopes.

description: A contentious battle is unfolding over the Centre’s move to introduce the Higher Education Commission of India Bill, with CPI(M) MP John Brittas urging ministers to halt the plan until the draft is made public and stakeholders are consulted. He warns that rushing the overhaul risks undermining autonomy, federal principles and the governance structure of India’s higher-education system.

Sandeshkhali case: Witness against TMC leader hurt in accident; was enroute to court
description: A key witness in the Sandeshkhali attack case, Bholanath Ghosh, was critically injured in a road accident where his car was hit by a truck. His son and driver died in the incident. Ghosh's family alleges a conspiracy by TMC leader Shahjahan Sheikh, currently in jail, to silence him. The accident occurred while Ghosh was en route to court.

The Royal Challengers Bengaluru mentor emphasized the intricate work behind team selection.

'My hero': Mahieka Sharma shares emotional posts; declares Hardik Pandya the 'king'
description: Hardik Pandya marked a powerful return from injury, leading India to a dominant win against South Africa and earning Player of the Match. He credited his comeback to self-belief and the unwavering support of loved ones, especially his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma. Pandya expressed his commitment to enjoying the game and striving for continuous improvement.

title: Satya Nadella on India’s AI ambition: ‘Adoption, not invention, decides the winners’
'Went to Thailand for work': Goa nightclub owners seek transit anticipatory bail
description: Luthra brothers, owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, seek transit anticipatory bail in Delhi, claiming they traveled to Thailand for work and intend to cooperate with the investigation. Meanwhile, their beach shack in Goa is slated for demolition following a devastating fire that killed 25 people at their nightclub.

Post Malone falls while performing in India; dusts himself off and walks into the crowd. Watch
Goa fire: Nightclub co-owner hid in Delhi hospital to stall arrest; how police smoked him out
description: Goa nightclub co-owner Ajay Gupta was apprehended in a Delhi hospital after allegedly feigning spine issues to evade arrest in the deadly blaze. He was detained by Delhi Police's Crime Branch and will be handed over to Goa Police for further questioning regarding the nightclub's management and fire-safety lapses.

title: India’s student suicide crisis: A nation watching marks, missing minds
description: India’s student-suicide crisis is no longer a series of isolated tragedies but a structural failure unfolding across classrooms and homes. NCRB data shows a steep decade-long rise, while recent cases expose how humiliation, bullying, fractured communication and stigma go unnoticed. Experts, principals and parents argue that prevention demands emotionally safe schools, responsive families and systems that learn to listen early.

title: H-1b visas: US Embassy's advisory to applicants - 'Will not be allowed inside if'
description: US Embassy India has issued a crucial advisory for visa applicants, warning that attending a previously scheduled appointment after receiving a rescheduling notice will lead to denied entry. This comes as H-1B visa interviews are being postponed due to new social media vetting rules, potentially delaying foreign workers' return to the US for months.

title: Consequences companies could face under Right to Disconnect Bill
description: The Right to Disconnect Bill outlines clear consequences for companies that continue to demand after-hours availability, proposing financial penalties, mandatory transparency, and enforceable communication norms. While not yet enacted, the proposal signals a decisive shift in how India expects employers to respect personal time. If adopted, it could redefine accountability in an era where digital overreach has become routine.

title: Gujarat teen chops friend into pieces over affairs
description: Jealousy over a shared love interest led to a brutal murder in Kutch. A 19-year-old allegedly killed his friend, dismembered the body, and buried the parts across the district. The crime surfaced after the victim's brother filed a missing person report, triggering an investigation that revealed a complex love triangle and a desperate attempt to conceal the horrific act.

title: Gabrielle Union says Dwyane Wade’s mom and sister initially had issues with her
description: Gabrielle Union revealed Dwyane Wade's family, particularly his sister, initially questioned her intentions due to their age difference and her childless status. The couple also navigated the fallout from Wade fathering a child with another woman during a 2013 separation. Despite these challenges, their love prevailed, leading to their 2014 marriage.

title: PIO nurse sentenced to jail in UK for raping and assaulting colleagues in care home
description: An Indian-origin nurse, Naijil Paul, has been sentenced to over seven years in jail in Scotland for raping a colleague and sexually assaulting two others. Paul fled to India before his 2019 trial but was extradited after six years. He pleaded guilty to the charges, which occurred in 2018 while he managed Acorn Park Care Home in Glasgow.

title: Stronger than milk? Researchers point to an unexpected food for bone health
description: Cottage cheese is emerging as a surprising powerhouse for bone health, offering more than just calcium. This humble dairy product is packed with protein, phosphorus, and other essential nutrients that support bone density and muscle strength across all ages. Its easy digestibility and versatility make it an accessible way to boost nutrition and well-being.

title: Brittany Mahomes goes silent after Mahomes–Kelce meltdown rocks Chiefs
description: Kansas City Chiefs faced a tough loss against the Houston Texans. Quarterback Patrick Mahomes and player Travis Kelce struggled on the field. Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes, remained silent on social media after the game. This quiet response mirrored the disappointment felt by many fans. The team's playoff hopes are now uncertain.

title: Ayesha Curry on women pursuing Steph: “I’ve wanted to punch them”
description: Ayesha Curry revealed on 'Red Table Talk' that she sometimes feels the urge to confront women who approach her husband, Stephen Curry, due to his naturally friendly demeanor. She later expressed regret about her appearance on the show, attributing the backlash to the platform's chaotic nature and the misinterpretation of her words.

title: Silent Hill 1 Remake: Release date, platforms, gameplay, and key details
description: Konami's Silent Hill franchise revival continues with the highly-anticipated Silent Hill 1 remake, now in full production by Bloober Team. This modern update to the 1999 survival horror classic is rumored to feature expanded exploration and modernized gameplay. Fans anticipate a Summer 2027 release on PC and PlayStation 5, with potential showcases at The Game Awards 2025.

title: 'Not gonna lie': Naomi Osaka rejects proposal, opens up on tough days as mom
description: Naomi Osaka opened up about motherhood's challenges and rejected a fan's marriage proposal during an Instagram Q&A. Despite an injury-shortened 2025 season ending at the Japan Open, she expressed pride in her resilience and gratitude for her health and daughter, Shai. Osaka is slated to begin her 2026 season at the ASB Classic.
